com.apriori.concurrent

Class CompletableFutures

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.apriori.concurrent.CompletableFutures

  • public final class CompletableFutures
extends Object
    Additional helper methods for creating and using instances of CompletableFuture.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static <T> CompletableFuture<T> callAsync(Callable<T> c)
      Calls the given task asynchronously, returning a future that represents its completion.
      static <T> CompletableFuture<T> callAsync(Callable<T> c, Executor executor)
      Calls the given task asynchronously, returning a future that represents its completion.
      static <T> CompletableFuture<T> callInterruptiblyAsync(Callable<T> c)
      Calls the given task asynchronously, returning a future that represents its completion.
      static <T> CompletableFuture<T> callInterruptiblyAsync(Callable<T> c, Executor executor)
      Calls the given task asynchronously, returning a future that represents its completion.
      static <T> CompletableFuture<T> cancelledFuture()
      Like CompletableFuture.completedFuture(Object), except that it returns an immediately cancelled future, instead of one that is immediately successful.
      static <T> CompletableFuture<T> failedFuture(Throwable failure)
      Like CompletableFuture.completedFuture(Object), except that it returns an immediately failed future, instead of one that is immediately successful.
      static CompletableFuture<Void> runInterruptiblyAsync(Runnable r)
      Returns a CompletableFuture that completes when the given task completes.
      static CompletableFuture<Void> runInterruptiblyAsync(Runnable r, Executor executor)
      Returns a CompletableFuture that completes when the given task completes.

    • Method Detail

      • failedFuture

        public static <T> CompletableFuture<T> failedFuture(Throwable failure)
        Like CompletableFuture.completedFuture(Object), except that it returns an immediately failed future, instead of one that is immediately successful.
        Parameters:
        failure - the cause of the future's failure
        Returns:
        an immediately failed future

      • cancelledFuture

        public static <T> CompletableFuture<T> cancelledFuture()
        Like CompletableFuture.completedFuture(Object), except that it returns an immediately cancelled future, instead of one that is immediately successful.
        Returns:
        an immediately cancelled future

      • runInterruptiblyAsync

        public static CompletableFuture<Void> runInterruptiblyAsync(Runnable r)
        Returns a CompletableFuture that completes when the given task completes. The task is run asynchronously in the ForkJoinPool.commonPool().

        Unlike CompletableFuture.runAsync(Runnable), if the returned future is cancelled and allowed to interrupt, it will attempt to interrupt the task if it is still running.

        Parameters:
        r - the task to run
        Returns:
        a future that completes when the task finishes

      • runInterruptiblyAsync

        public static CompletableFuture<Void> runInterruptiblyAsync(Runnable r,
                                                            Executor executor)
        Returns a CompletableFuture that completes when the given task completes.

        Unlike CompletableFuture.runAsync(Runnable, Executor), if the returned future is cancelled and allowed to interrupt, it will attempt to interrupt the task if it is still running.

        Parameters:
        r - the task to run
        executor - the executor that is used to run the task asynchronously
        Returns:
        a future that completes when the task finishes

      • callAsync

        public static <T> CompletableFuture<T> callAsync(Callable<T> c)
        Calls the given task asynchronously, returning a future that represents its completion. The task is run asynchronously in the ForkJoinPool.commonPool().

        This is like CompletableFuture.supplyAsync(Supplier) except that it takes a Callable, which is allowed to throw checked exceptions.

        Parameters:
        c - the task to call
        Returns:
        a future that completes with the value computed by the given task

      • callAsync

        public static <T> CompletableFuture<T> callAsync(Callable<T> c,
                                                 Executor executor)
        Calls the given task asynchronously, returning a future that represents its completion.

        This is like CompletableFuture.supplyAsync(Supplier, Executor) except that it takes a Callable, which is allowed to throw checked exceptions.

        Parameters:
        c - the task to call
        executor - the executor that is used to run the task asynchronously
        Returns:
        a future that completes with the value computed by the given task

      • callInterruptiblyAsync

        public static <T> CompletableFuture<T> callInterruptiblyAsync(Callable<T> c)
        Calls the given task asynchronously, returning a future that represents its completion. The task is run asynchronously in the ForkJoinPool.commonPool().

        Unlike callAsync(Callable), if the returned future is cancelled and allowed to interrupt, it will attempt to interrupt the task if it is still running.

        Parameters:
        c - the task to call
        Returns:
        a future that completes with the value computed by the given task

      • callInterruptiblyAsync

        public static <T> CompletableFuture<T> callInterruptiblyAsync(Callable<T> c,
                                                              Executor executor)
        Calls the given task asynchronously, returning a future that represents its completion.

        Unlike callAsync(Callable, Executor), if the returned future is cancelled and allowed to interrupt, it will attempt to interrupt the task if it is still running.

        Parameters:
        c - the task to call
        executor - the executor that is used to run the task asynchronously
        Returns:
        a future that completes with the value computed by the given task
